result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:56 - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Demonddre M Myers. 
Defendant Demonddre M Myers in court. 
Attorney Hughes requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Demonddre M Myers in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Demonddre M Myers. City of New Berlin Police Department Officer Chad Cowdy sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will. Cross examination by Attorney Hughes. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Hughes objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:44 PM Defendant Demonddre M Myers in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Intern Patrick Sicula for Attorney Steven Hughes.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court takes a short recess at 1:51 PM.  Matter recalled at 1:53 PM with the same appearances.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
